abstract: Makeshift kitchen in Zuccotti Park has fed thousands of Occupy Wall Street protesters each day, and is developing a cuisine that is free-form, eclectic, improvisatory and contradictory; requests for food go out on Twitter and various Web sites sympathetic to the protesters and somehow in spontaneous waves, day after day, the food pours in.
snippet: A makeshift kitchen at Zuccotti Park has fed thousands of Occupy Wall Street protesters each day, developing a cuisine that is free-form, eclectic, improvisatory and contradictory.
lead_paragraph: A makeshift kitchen at Zuccotti Park has fed thousands of Occupy Wall Street protesters each day, developing a cuisine that is free-form, eclectic, improvisatory and contradictory.

headline.main: Want to Get Fat on Wall Street? Try Protesting
headline.print_headline: Want to Get Fat on Wall Street? Try Protesting
headline.seo: Protesters at ‘Occupy Wall Street’ Eat Well
